required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacogenomic Analysis in Pediatric Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacogenomic Analysis of 6-mercaptopurine in Pediatric Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective biobank study evaluating the impact of novel genetic variants in a population of 6-mercaptopurine treated pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The study objective is to clinically validate that the presence of recently discovered novel genetic variation adversely affects a population of 6-mercaptopurine treated pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia patients using biobank samples.

primary_outcome.measure: Novel genetic variants impact on 6-mercaptopurine adverse drug reactions
primary_outcome.description: Objective is to clinically validate the presence of novel genetic variants and its impact on adverse drug reactions in a population of pediatric ALL patients treated with 6-MP

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluating relationship of genetic variants to ancestry
secondary_outcome.description: A secondary objective of this study is to compare the impact of the novel genetic variants with other known genetic variants contributing to ADR risk.

arm_group.description: Pediatric ALL patients treated with 6-mercaptopurine who did not experience neutropenia.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Pediatric ALL patients on 6-mercaptopurine with neutropenia
arm_group.description: Pediatric ALL patients treated with 6-mercaptopurine who experienced neutropenia.

biospec_descr.textblock: Observational study of previously collected biobank specimens

study_pop.textblock: The study population are pediatric patients, under 21 years of age, diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia patients between April 20, 2012 to August 6, 2020, and received 6-mercaptopurine for therapeutic purposes. All patients were recruited by the investigators at Stanford University Lucile Packard Children's Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) subjects
- Received 6-mercaptopurine
- Available biobank (bone marrow or blood) sample(s) from which deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) can be extracted
- White blood cell (WBC) levels
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric ALL subjects who did NOT receive 6-mercaptopurine
- No biobank sample
- No WBC level
